byline.original: By NICHOLAS CASEY and AL BAKER

abstract: Effort by New York City Police Department to clean up notorious block of 125th Street between Lexington and Park Avenues has forced once-sizable homeless population out of area; bodegas on block have stopped selling synthetic marijuana known as K2, which was popular among homeless, after recent raids on makers and marketers of drug.
lead_paragraph: New York City police said they had joined an effort with other agencies to clean up 125th Street, addressing a host of so-called quality of life issues, such as drug use and violent crime.

headline.main: Homeless on East Harlem Street Feel Unwanted Pressure After Drug Raids
headline.print_headline: Homeless on 125th St. Feel Unwanted Pressure After Drug Raids

snippet: New York City police said they had joined an effort with other agencies to clean up 125th Street, addressing a host of so-called quality of life issues, such as drug use and violent crime.
